Applify Docs

Getting Started

Thank you for purchasing Applify!
This is the basic documentation to help you get started. All HTML, CSS, JS, and PHP code are well commented and pretty self-explanatory. If you need any help please submit a support ticket through Envato.

Migrating from Applify v1.0 to v2.0

Applify v2.0 is built on the new and improved Bootstrap 4 framework.
Thus all deprecated Bootstrap CSS class names will not work anymore. Please read this documentation for further assistance.

To make sure your HTML markup from Applify v1.0 will work correctly, you need to go through every HTML component and make sure the markup and CSS class name match those of Applify v2.0.

You will most likely need to change:

  • The navigation bar's markup and CSS classes
  • The bootstrap columns CSS class names (col-xs-* to col-*)

What's included

Files included with Applify.

  • root
    • assets CSS, JS, Icons, and Images
      • css Main CSS
      • icons Icons Fonts
      • img Images
      • js Javascript & jQuery

    • sass Applify SCSS
      • applify Applify SCSS files
        • components UI Components
        • core Applify Base & Configuration
        • libs External Libraries
        • mixins Applify Mixins
        • modules Applify Modules
        • utilities UI Utilities
        • _applify.scss Applify Theme SCSS Init
      • bootstrap-4.0.0-beta Bootstrap 4 Library
      • style.scss Applify Main SCSS Init

Gradients

Applify has 4 gradient background styles. These class can be added to most elements to add a gradient background.

.ui-gradient-purple
.ui-gradient-peach
.ui-gradient-green
.ui-gradient-blue
Example
			
				<a class="btn ui-gradient-green"></a>
				<div class="ui-hero ui-gradient-blue"></div>
				<div class="ui-card ui-gradient-purple"></div>

Hero

Applify heroes require the .ui-hero css class. For a large hero (home demos) add .hero-lg and for a small hero (blog demos) add .hero-sm.
Applify comes with 3 extra hero styles. 

				
					// Adds a waves layer to hero
					<div class="ui-hero hero-lg ui-waves">

					// Creates a curved hero
					<div class="ui-hero hero-lg ui-curve">

					// Creates a titled hero
					<div class="ui-hero hero-lg ui-tilt">

					// Small Hero
					<div class="ui-hero hero-sm">

Curved Hero with Gradient Example
			
				<div class="ui-hero hero-lg ui-curve ui-gradient-peach">

Slider Hero

The slider uses the jQuery plugin Slider Pro. For detailed instructions please read the official docs. Applify allows you to set some of the options with data- attributes. 

			
				<div class="ui-hero ui-hero-slider slider-pro hero-lg ui-gradient-purple"
					data-fade="true"
					data-touch_swipe="false"
					data-auto_play="true"
					data-autoplay_delay="4500"
					data-autoplay_on_hover="none"
					data-show_dots="true"
					data-show_arrows="true"
				>

Layer animations are achieved with Slider Pro's native functionality. Read this for an official example.

Ultra High-Density / Retina Images

Image Element

Add the attribute data-uhd to any image element and Applify will automatically change the image src from "image_path.jpg" to "image_path@2x.jpg" when a device has a high-density display. 

			
				<img src="path_to_image.jpg" data-uhd />
Background Image

For background images, add the attribute data-bg="image_path.jpg" to any element and Applify with make that image the background. It will also add the @2x post-fix to the image if necessary. 

			
				<div data-bg="path_to_image.jpg" data-uhd >...</div>

CSS Animations

Required Attributes

Elements with the data-show attribute will animate on_scroll when they are in the viewport. The .animate CSS class is required for the CSS animations to work.

			
				<div class="animate" data-show="fade-in-up"></div>
Animation Types

Applify comes with a few animation types. Add any of the animation names below to an element's data-show attribute.

			
				<div class="animate" data-show="fade-in">
				<div class="animate" data-show="fade-in-up">
				<div class="animate" data-show="fade-in-left">
				<div class="animate" data-show="fade-in-right">

Google Map

Google API Key

To use the Google Maps JavaScript API, you must register your website on the Google API Console and get a Google API key.
Once you have your API Key add it to the end of the javascript include element. 

			
				<script src="https://maps.googleapis.com/maps/api/js?key=YOUR_API_KEY">
Latitude and Longitude

The map's latitude and longitude are defined by the data-lat and data-long attributes. Simply change the values to your own.

			
				<div class="map-canvas" data-lat="-26.182559" data-lng="28.061691">
Map Marker Image

Change the map marker image by changing the data-marker attribute of the map. 

			
				<div class="map-canvas" data-marker="img/map/map_marker.png">

Instagram Widget

Client ID and Authorization Token

To use the Instagram JavaScript API, you need an Instagram Client ID and Authorization Token. Start by registering at Instagram Developers to get a Client ID. This article might help you to generate an Access Token for Instagram.
Once you have your Client ID and Access Token add it to the data-authtoken and data-userid attributes of the Instagram widget element. 

			
				<div class="insta-feed" data-authtoken="YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN" data-userid="YOUR_USER_ID">

SASS and JS

Working with SASS and customizing the main Javascript files. (Advance users)

SASS: You need a SASS compiler to compiler to compile the .scss file to a .css file. Many IDE's come with this feature built in. Applify comes with a Grunt file that will automatically compile SCSS to CSS everytime a .scss file changes. Instructions are below.

JS: Applify uses UglifyJS to build all javascript files into a single minified .js file. Applify comes with a Grunt file that will automatically do all the work every time a .js file changes. Instructions are below.

Build System

To compile SASS and build JS using Applify's package.json file you need Node.

  1. Download and install Node.js, to manage the dependencies. Instructions here.
  2. Open your command line editor.
  3. Navigate cd to the root directory of your website and run npm install to install Applify's local dependencies listed in package.json.
  4. Run grunt to start GruntWatch that will automaticaly compile and build the .scss and .js files every time one has changed.

    5.  
			
				<div class="insta-feed" data-authtoken="YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN" data-userid="YOUR_USER_ID">
